etymology.description: 因(因) (yīn, "cause") as phonetic + 心(心) (xīn, "heart") as semantic = essence of heart -> benevolence/grace
etymology.interpretation: The character 恩(恩) (ēn, "grace") combines 因(因) (yīn, "cause") for its phonetic component with 心(心) (xīn, "heart") to represent the concept of grace or benevolence originating from the heart.

examples.chinese: 他的恩情无人能忘(他的恩情無人能忘)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de ēnqíng wú rén néng wàng.
examples.english: No one can forget his benevolence.

examples.chinese: 妈妈的恩惠永存(媽媽的恩惠永存)，滋养了我们的心灵(滋養了我們的心靈)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā de ēnhuì yǒngcún, zīyǎngle wǒmen de xīnlíng.
examples.english: A mother's grace lives forever, nurturing our hearts.

examples.chinese: 接受别人的恩(接受別人的恩)，使生活充满温暖(使生活充滿溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Jiēshòu biérén de ēn, shǐ shēnghuó chōngmǎn wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: Accepting others' kindness makes life warm.
